thread.title: Britain’s youngest MP Mhairi Black may quit "depressing" Parliament
thread.title_full: Britain’s youngest MP Mhairi Black may quit "depressing" Parliament

author: Jason Beattie
title: Britain’s youngest MP Mhairi Black may quit "depressing" Parliament

persons.name: tory jacob rees-mogg share mhairi black

text:
Britain’s youngest MP Mhairi Black may quit "depressing" Parliament The SNP MP says she "hates" Westminster but reveals a surprising friendship with Tory Jacob Rees-Mogg Share Mhairi Black says Westminster is a "waste of time" (Photo: Parliament Live TV) Share Get politics updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Britain’s youngest MP says she may stand down at the next general election because Parliament is “depressing.” 
The SNP ’s Mhairi Black, who was 20 when elected in 2015, says she “hates” Westminster. 
She told the Sunday Post : “It has been nearly two years and I still hate the place. 
“It is depressing. 
“It is the personal elements – it is a pain to come up and down every week and you are working with a number of people you find quite troubling. 
“Professionally, it is more just that so little gets done. 
“It is so old and defunct in terms of its systems and procedures – a lot of the time, it is just a waste of time.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Share this video Watch Next 
Asked if she would stand again at the 2020 general election, she replied: “I don’t know.” 
Ms Black was the youngest MP to be elected since 1667 when she won Paisley and Renfrewshire South from Labour two years’ ago. 
She quickly made her mark with a series of passionate speeches denouncing the Tory welfare cuts and Trident renewal . 
But she says she’s fed up with being asked about her age. 
“I’m sick of folk mentioning it. During the campaign, no one asked about my age, it was all in-depth political questions. Tory MP Jacob Rees-Mogg is one of Ms Black's closest friends in Westminster 
“What I always say is that trying to tailor politics to be ‘young, hip and cool’ is exactly the kind of patronising guff that puts off young folk. If you want to talk to young folk about politics then just talk politics. They will listen.” Read More "You talk s***e, hen": MP Mhairi Black lays into Tory minister over housing benefit cuts 
Ms Black said she had made some friends in Westminster, including the Eton-educated Tory MP Jacob Rees-Mogg whom she jokingly called her “boyfriend”. 
“I get on quite well with a lot of the Labour old guard and quite a few Tories actually. 
“There is my boyfriend – Jacob Rees-Mogg. He’s my favourite. 
“It’s the kind of place where, if you are reasonable with folk then they will soften a little,” she said. Like us on Facebook
